message.content:
<<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken
<<<code>>>: import java.util.*;

public class Main {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in);
        ArrayList<String> words = new ArrayList<String>();
        String word;
        while (!(word = sc.next()).equals("okay")) {
            words.add(word);
        }
        String[] copy = words.toArray(new String[0]);
        for (String s : copy) {
            System.out.println(s);
        }
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: In this code, we are using an ArrayList instead of an array because the size of an ArrayList can change dynamically. We read words from the standard input using a Scanner until we encounter the word "okay". Each word is added to the ArrayList. After the loop, we convert the ArrayList to an array using the toArray() method. Finally, we print out each word in the array.
